result.execSummary:
The defendant Clarence L Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fin.Trans.Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a)1a.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing 10/01/2016 or penalty of 10 days Huber for non-payment.  (4 days credit if time to be served).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clarence L Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Clarence L Brown in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended information filed.  Defendant pleads guilty to amended count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Fragoso makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  

FINE:  $1009.00

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing 10/01/2016. Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 10 days in Huber (4 days credit if time to be served).
